connector.description: Store and Retrieve data from/to AWS SDB service.

camel.sink.path.domainName.name: camel.sink.path.domainName
camel.sink.path.domainName.description: The name of the domain currently worked with.

camel.sink.endpoint.amazonSDBClient.name: camel.sink.endpoint.amazonSDBClient
camel.sink.endpoint.amazonSDBClient.description: To use the AmazonSimpleDB as the client

camel.sink.endpoint.consistentRead.name: camel.sink.endpoint.consistentRead
camel.sink.endpoint.consistentRead.description: Determines whether or not strong consistency should be enforced when data is read.

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.maxNumberOfDomains.name: camel.sink.endpoint.maxNumberOfDomains
camel.sink.endpoint.maxNumberOfDomains.description: The maximum number of domain names you want returned. The range is 1 to 100.

camel.sink.endpoint.proxyHost.name: camel.sink.endpoint.proxyHost
camel.sink.endpoint.proxyHost.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the SDB client

camel.sink.endpoint.proxyPort.name: camel.sink.endpoint.proxyPort
camel.sink.endpoint.proxyPort.description: To define a proxy port when instantiating the SDB client

camel.sink.endpoint.proxyProtocol.name: camel.sink.endpoint.proxyProtocol
camel.sink.endpoint.proxyProtocol.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the SDB client One of: [HTTP] [HTTPS]

camel.sink.endpoint.region.name: camel.sink.endpoint.region
camel.sink.endpoint.region.description: The region in which SDB client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the capitalized name of the region (for example AP_EAST_1) You'll need to use the name Regions.EU_WEST_1.name()

camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous
camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.component.aws-sdb.lazyStartProduce.name: camel.component.aws-sdb.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.aws-sdb.lazyStartProduce.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.aws-sdb.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.aws-sdb.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.aws-sdb.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
